clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of Mood on Cerebral Perfusion
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Mood on Cerebral Perfusion

brief_summary.textblock: Measuring brain perfusion is biased by a inter- and intrasubject variability, caused by physiological and lifestyle factors. In this study, the investigators want to investigate the effects of a different mood state (neutral, positive and negative mood), induced using subjects own memories, on both global and regional cerebral perfusion, measured with arterial spin labeling.

primary_outcome.measure: Regional Cerebral perfusion (ml/100g/min) during positive mood induction
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 minutes (ASL scan during mood state induction)
primary_outcome.description: Effect of positive mood induction (using volunteer's own memories) on cerebral perfusion using arterial spin labeling MRI.

primary_outcome.measure: Regional Cerebral perfusion (ml/100g/min) during negative mood induction
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 minutes (ASL scan during mood state induction)
primary_outcome.description: Effect of negative mood induction (using volunteer's own memories) on cerebral perfusion using arterial spin labeling MRI.

primary_outcome.measure: Regional Cerebral perfusion (ml/100g/min) during neutral mood induction
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 minutes (ASL scan during mood state induction)
primary_outcome.description: Effect of neutral mood induction (using volunteer's own memories) on cerebral perfusion using arterial spin labeling MRI.

primary_outcome.measure: Regional Cerebral perfusion (ml/100g/min) after positive mood induction
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 minutes (ASL scan after mood state induction)
primary_outcome.description: Effect of positive mood (using volunteer's own memories) on cerebral perfusion using arterial spin labeling MRI.

primary_outcome.measure: Regional Cerebral perfusion (ml/100g/min) after negative mood induction
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 minutes (ASL scan after mood state induction)
primary_outcome.description: Effect of negative mood (using volunteer's own memories) on cerebral perfusion using arterial spin labeling MRI.

primary_outcome.measure: Regional Cerebral perfusion (ml/100g/min) after neutral mood induction
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 minutes (ASL scan after mood state induction)
primary_outcome.description: Effect of neutral mood (using volunteer's own memories) on cerebral perfusion using arterial spin labeling MRI.

arm_group.description: Mood induction: positive, negative, neutral mood (using subjects own memories) Arterial spin labeling MRI Physiological monitoring

intervention.description: Subjects deliver three positive, three negative and three neutral memories 30 seconds reliving a memory - answering questions about the memory - reliving memory for 2 minutes during ASL-MRI
During MRI: heart rate, end-tidal CO2, respiratory rate and skin conductance

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy university students
- between 18 and 30 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- No informed consent
- Not using hormonal contraception
- MRI-contraindications
- Claustrophobia
- Pregnancy
- Chronic diseases and chronic medication use
